alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Cover up plants, especially those in frost-prone areas. Take preventative measures to protect frost-sensitive plants and trees.

alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas.

Temperatures are expected to fall to the freezing mark early Thursday morning.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: frost advisory ended
alerts.description:
Widespread frost is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas.

Temperatures are expected to fall to the freezing mark tonight into Friday morning.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: waterspout watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of waterspouts this afternoon and this evening. The potential for waterspouts may continue overnight into Friday morning.

###

Wind speeds inside the spray ring of a waterspout are 45 knots or higher. Vulnerable vessels are at risk of damage or capsizing.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are urged to take all necessary precautions and prepare for the possibility of waterspout activity. Postpone voyage or seek safe harbour if possible.
